intro: Cracca calophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf cracca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its silvery-white, velvety leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Cracca calophylla is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
